title.narrative: Rural Water Supply and Sanitation Project for Low Income States

description.narrative: The project development objective is to improve piped water supply and sanitation services for selected rural communities in the target states through decentralized delivery systems and to increase the capacity of the Participating States to respond promptly and effectively to an Eligible Crisis or Emergency.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Jal Shakti, Department of Drinking Water and Sanitation

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Implementation Units | Description :Recipient to constitute and maintain: (a) Steering Committee for overallpolicy guidance, implementation coordination and monitoring; (b) NPMU for implementation at the national level; (c) TAG responsiblefor independently reviewing and guidance; (d) each Participating States- SPMUs - responsible for implementation at State level;and (e) DPMUs responsible for Project implementation in Districts. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Procurement | Description :All goods, works and non-consulting services, other than part D; Consulting services;and all goods, works, non-consulting servicesrequired for Part D to be procured in accordance with the Procurement Guidelines, theProcurement Plan, the Financing Agreement andthe Project Implementation Plan (PIP). | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Project Agreements- Capacity of Implementation Units | Description :Participating States to ensure that StateProject Implementing Agencies, District Project Management Units and Water and SanitationCommittees of Gram Panchayats in theirrespective Participating State each have an adequate organizational structure with functions,powers, professional support andresources necessary to carry out the Project, including convergence with NRDWP and NBA programs. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Project Agreements- Implementation Units | Description :Participating States to: (a) maintain State ProjectManagement Units responsible for Project implementation at the State level; (b)constitute and maintain District Project ManagementUnits responsible for Project implementation in the Project Districts; and (c) constitute and maintain water and sanitationcommittees in Gram Panchayats responsible for Project implementation at the village level. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Project Agreements- Project Review and Reports | Description :Participating States to carry out: (a) acomprehensive mid-term Project review, and to prepare and furnish to IDA a mid-term Project progress report, by March 31, 2017; and(b) a comprehensive Project completion review, and to prepare and furnish to IDA a Projectcompletion report, within 90 days afterthe Closing Date. | Due Date :31-Mar-2017

Finance Agreement :Project Agreements- Special Conditions of Part D Activities | Description :Participating States not to undertakeany activities under Part D (in the case of an Eligible Crisis or Emergency) unless and until special conditions have been met. |Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Project Agreements-Contingency Emergency Response Mechanism | Description :Participating States to prepare andfurnish to the Association a Part D in PIP setting out implementation arrangements for Part D of the Project (in the case of anEligible Crisis or Emergency), and to ensure that Part D is carried out in accordance with Part D,PIP. Participating States tomaintain a Coordinating Authority with adequate staff and resources to carry out activities under PartD. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Project Reviews and Reports | Description :Recipient to carry out, and cause the Participating States to carryout: (a) a comprehensive mid-term Project review, and to prepare and furnish to IDA a mid-term Project progress report, by March31, 2017; and (b) a comprehensive Project completion review, and to prepare and furnish to IDA a Project completion report, within90 days after the Closing Date. | Due Date :31-Mar-2017

Finance Agreement :Withdrawal Conditions for Part D | Description :No withdrawals for payments for Eligible Expenditures underCategory (2) (regarding Part D of the Project, in the case of an Eligible Crisis or Emergency) unless special conditions have beenmet. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

title.narrative: Number of Participating States having increase their capacity to handle an eligible crisis
GPs action plans for solid, liquid waste and fecal sludge management (SLWM) implemented in Project GPs
External Audits of environmental performance completed.
States having adopted an O & M policy empowering GPs to operate and maintain water supply schemes, either directly or through a performance based third party agreement.
Number of piped water schemes funded under the project
Number of GP/Village or Multi-village Water and Sanitation Committees trained to become professional customer-focused water serviceproviders under the Project
Households provided with 24/7 piped water supply services by a decentralized (not State-level) water and sanitation service provider
People trained to improve hygiene behavior, sanitation, SLWM under the Project
Number of piped water supply schemes which recover 50% or more of O&M cost by way of water tariff and GP level contributions
New piped household water connections that are resulting from the project intervention
Schemes which have carried out at least one social audit
Schemes with over 80% of satisfaction with service provided (yearly beneficiary assessments)
Schemes with a collection ratio of water charges of at least 50%
National, State, and District Level institutions are set up, staffed and fully functional: NPMU, SPMU, and DPMU.
Population benefiting from improved grey water management under the project
Number of piped water schemes completed under the Project
GP-WSCs with at least 33% woman members
People trained to improve hygiene behavior, sanitation SLWM under the Project - female
Project GPs that have been verified as open-defecation free
Schemes which have carried out independent supervision quality checks
Web-based monitoring system developed to assess performance of piped water supply schemes
